thread.title: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 with Snapdragon 625 SoC and 4,100mAh battery launched, prices start at Rs 9,999
thread.title_full: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 with Snapdragon 625 SoC and 4,100mAh battery launched, prices start at Rs 9,999

title: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 with Snapdragon 625 SoC and 4,100mAh battery launched, prices start at Rs 9,999
text:
Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 with Snapdragon 625 SoC and 4,100mAh battery launched,... Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 with Snapdragon 625 SoC and 4,100mAh battery launched, prices start at Rs 9,999 By - January 19, 2017 “The Redmi Note 4 sports up to 64GB of storage, 13MP/5MP cameras, and a 4,100mAh battery” 
Xiaomi added a new smartphone to its popular Redmi range with the launch of the Redmi Note 4 in China in August last year. Today, the company has finally launched the phone in India. The phone comes as a successor to the widely popular Redmi Note 3 ( review ) . It comes with more horsepower and an improved design over its predecessor. 
The Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 features a metal unibody design with a fingerprint sensor located at its back panel. It features a 5.5-inch full HD display with 2.5D curved glass on top. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 processor, mated to Adreno 506 graphics. The phone comes in three different RAM and storage configurations in India – 2GB + 32GB, 3GB + 32GB and 4GB + 64GB. Software-wise, it boots Android Marshmallow-based MIUI 8. 
The camera department includes a 13-megapixel primary camera with f/2.0 aperture with PDAF, as well as a front 5-megapixel snapper with an intelligent beautification mode. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, VoLTE, hybrid dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, IR blaster, USB OTG, and GPS. It also gets a microSD card slot that can expand storage up to 128GB. A beefy 4,100mAh battery powers the show. 
Coming to the price, the Redmi Note 4’s 2GB / 32GB variant has been priced at Rs 9,999, 3GB / 32GB at Rs 10,999 and 4GB / 64GB at Rs 12,999. The Redmi Note 4 will go on open sale on January 23rd via Flipkart and Mi.com in gold and grey hues. There’s also a new matte black colour option that will be available at a later date.
